alert.note: Alert for Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 5:40PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Weston and southwestern Crook Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 539 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles west of Keyhole Reservoir to 8 miles southeast of Moorcroft to 15 miles southwest of Upton. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pine Haven and Keyhole Reservoir around 545 PM MDT. Carlile around 555 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Upton and Devils Tower Junction. This includes Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 152 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
